body_html: @angersson imho, I think this is a bug. Notice that for the same model, tf.keras.losses.categorical_crossentropy lets it converge, but tf.losses.softmax_cross_entropy does not. So this shows a case when the compatibility in tf fails. Thanks for looking into it.
body_text: @angersson imho, I think this is a bug. Notice that for the same model, tf.keras.losses.categorical_crossentropy lets it converge, but tf.losses.softmax_cross_entropy does not. So this shows a case when the compatibility in tf fails. Thanks for looking into it.
body: @angersson imho, I think this is a bug. Notice that for the same model, `tf.keras.losses.categorical_crossentropy` lets it converge, but `tf.losses.softmax_cross_entropy` does not. So this shows a case when the compatibility in `tf` fails. Thanks for looking into it.
